meanings.definition: A framework of parallel or crossed bars, typically used as a screen or barrier.
meanings.sent1: The cat squeezed through the gratings of the fence.
meanings.sent2: The window had metal gratings to prevent intruders.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to climb the gratings but got stuck halfway.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were like gratings, blocking out the light of reason.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the wind whistling through the gratings was eerie.

meanings.definition: A series of ridges or grooves on a surface.
meanings.sent1: The gratings on the sand dunes created interesting patterns.
meanings.sent2: The wooden floor had gratings that added texture to the room.
meanings.sent3: The chef used a special tool to create gratings of chocolate for the dessert.
meanings.sent4: Her voice had a roughness like the gratings of a metal file.
meanings.sent5: The gratings on the tree bark provided a foothold for the squirrel.

meanings.definition: An arrangement of metal bars or slats used for covering an opening.
meanings.sent1: The gratings on the sewer drain prevented debris from clogging it.
meanings.sent2: The basement windows were secured with heavy-duty gratings.
meanings.sent3: The magician made the rabbit disappear through the metal gratings.
meanings.sent4: His emotions were like the gratings, hiding his true feelings from others.
meanings.sent5: The moonlight shone through the gratings, casting shadows on the floor.
